column4: now I have another problem. Everything I'm trying to open with administrator rights locks up on me before it even asks me for a password. plz help.
what does 'sudo echo hi' do in a terminal?
is this the first account you created during install?
paste the output of the command 'groups'
well, that means you are not in the admin group
did you do an expert install by any chance?  and do you have access to root?
I do have access to root
you created a password manually after the install?
ok su to root and do 'adduser kevin admin'
okay, you amy want to add yourself to the adm dialout cdrom floppy audio dip video plugdev lpadmin scanner  groups as well
is the "save configuration" option in the logoff  screen important for my user settings?
no, I think that just saves what programs you ahve open and then opens them up next time you login
